workflow.name: Weekly SEO watchlist audit to Google Sheets with Gemini and Decodo
workflow.description:
## Weekly SEO Watchlist Audit to Google Sheets (Gemini + Decodo)

Sign up for Decodo [HERE](https://visit.decodo.com/discount) for Discount

Automatically fetches page content, generates a compact SEO audit (score, issues, fixes), and writes both a per-URL summary and a normalized ‚ÄúAll Issues‚Äù table to Google Sheets‚Äîgreat for weekly monitoring and prioritization.

## Who‚Äôs it for?
Content/SEO teams that want lightweight, scheduled audits of key pages with actionable next steps and spreadsheet reporting.

## How it works
1. Weekly trigger loads the Google Sheet of URLs.
2. Split in Batches processes each URL.
3. Decodo fetches page content (markdown + status).
4. Gemini produces a strict JSON audit via the AI Chain + Output Parser.
5. Code nodes flatten data for two tabs.
6. Google Sheets nodes append Summary and All Issues rows.
7. Split in Batches continues to the next URL.

## How to set up
- Add credentials for Google Sheets, [Decodo](https://visit.decodo.com/discount), and Gemini.
- Set `sheet_id` and Sheet GIDs in the Set node.
- Ensure input sheet has a `URL` column.
- Configure your Google Sheets tabs with proper headers matching each field being appended (e.g., URL, Decodo Score, Priority, etc.).
- Adjust schedule as needed.
- Activate the workflow.

parameters.content:
## Weekly SEO Watchlist Audit to Google Sheets (Gemini + Decodo)

Sign up for Decodo [HERE](https://visit.decodo.com/discount) for Discount

Automatically fetches page content, generates a compact SEO audit (score, issues, fixes), and writes both a per-URL summary and a normalized ‚ÄúAll Issues‚Äù table to Google Sheets‚Äîgreat for weekly monitoring and prioritization.

## Who‚Äôs it for?
Content/SEO teams that want lightweight, scheduled audits of key pages with actionable next steps and spreadsheet reporting.

## How it works
1. Weekly trigger loads the Google Sheet of URLs.
2. Split in Batches processes each URL.
3. Decodo fetches page content (markdown + status).
4. Gemini produces a strict JSON audit via the AI Chain + Output Parser.
5. Code nodes flatten data for two tabs.
6. Google Sheets nodes append Summary and All Issues rows.
7. Split in Batches continues to the next URL.

## How to set up
- Add credentials for Google Sheets, [Decodo](https://visit.decodo.com/discount), and Gemini.
- Set `sheet_id` and Sheet GIDs in the Set node.
- Ensure input sheet has a `URL` column.
- Configure your Google Sheets tabs with proper headers matching each field being appended (e.g., URL, Decodo Score, Priority, etc.).
- Adjust schedule as needed.
- Activate the workflow.

parameters.text:
=System:
You are an SEO Watchlist Agent.
Return only a valid JSON object and nothing else.
Output MUST be exactly this shape (no extra keys, no markdown):
{"output":[{...}]}
Do not return plain objects, arrays, strings, or explanations.
All numbers must be numeric (not strings).
If a field has no data, use null (except raw_decodo must be {}).

User:
Analyze the following webpage content (markdown) and produce an SEO audit JSON object.

INPUT
- url_hint: {{ $('Loop URLs (Split in Batches)').item.json.URL_list }}
- status_code: {{ $json.data.results[0].status_code }}
- fetched_at: {{ $json.data.results[0].updated_at }}
- content:
{{ $json.data.results[0].content }}

REQUIREMENTS
Return only this JSON object (with the "output" wrapper and a single-item array):

{
  "output": [
    {
      "url": "string",
      "decodo_score": 0,
      "top_issues": "semicolon-separated list of 3‚Äì5 key issues",
      "priority": "High|Medium|Low",
      "recommended_actions": ["up to 10 short, actionable fixes"],
      "suggested_meta": "120‚Äì155 chars",
      "suggested_title": "‚â§70 chars",
      "status": "ok|no_content|error",
      "raw_decodo": {},
      "last_checked": "UTC ISO 8601 with Z",
      "all_issues": [
        {
          "id": "kebab-case identifier",
          "title": "short issue name",
          "category": "On-Page|Technical|Content|Performance|Accessibility|Indexing|Internal Linking|Other",
          "severity": "High|Medium|Low",
          "evidence": "‚â§240 chars concrete proof from the page text",
          "recommendation": "how to fix",
          "impact": "High|Medium|Low",
          "effort": "Low|Medium|High",
          "score_delta": -1,
          "examples": ["example selector/url/snippet"]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

SCORING & RULES
- "url": use url_hint if present; otherwise null.
- "status": "no_content" if content is empty/null/whitespace; else "ok".
- "last_checked": current UTC timestamp with Z.
- "decodo_score": 0‚Äì100 based on on-page basics + content quality.
- Order "all_issues" High ‚Üí Medium ‚Üí Low; max 10 items.
- Evidence must come only from provided content (‚â§240 chars).
- If content empty: status="no_content", priority="Low", decodo_score=0, top_issues="No content detected", recommended_actions=[], all_issues=[].

STRICT OUTPUT RULES
- Return exactly one JSON object with a top-level "output" key whose value is an array with exactly one object.
- Do not emit any keys other than "output".
- Do not include code fences, prose, or additional arrays/objects.

messageValues.message:
=You are an SEO Watchlist Agent.
Return only a valid JSON object that matches the specified schema.
Do not include explanations, markdown, or arrays.
All numbers must be numeric, not strings.

={
  "output": [
    {
      "url": "string",
      "decodo_score": 0,
      "top_issues": "semicolon-separated list of 3‚Äì5 key issues",
      "priority": "High|Medium|Low",
      "recommended_actions": ["up to 10 short, actionable fixes"],
      "suggested_meta": "120‚Äì155 chars",
      "suggested_title": "‚â§70 chars",
      "status": "ok|no_content|error",
      "raw_decodo": {},
      "last_checked": "UTC ISO 8601 with Z",
      "all_issues": [
        {
          "id": "kebab-case identifier",
          "title": "short issue name",
          "category": "On-Page|Technical|Content|Performance|Accessibility|Indexing|Internal Linking|Other",
          "severity": "High|Medium|Low",
          "evidence": "‚â§240 chars concrete proof from the page text",
          "recommendation": "how to fix",
          "impact": "High|Medium|Low",
          "effort": "Low|Medium|High",
          "score_delta": -1,
          "examples": ["example selector/url/snippet"]
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}

parameters.content: ### Adjust interval to your reporting cadence (e.g., every Monday 09:00 UTC).
### Enter sheet_id for Input, Output, and All Issues tabs.
### Make sure your Input tab contains a column named URL.
### Ensure all columns match the expected field names in this node.
